data.name: AccessibilityStatement_Instructions
data.value:
This is an accessibility statement from the Ministry of Labour and Social Insurance’s service to apply for a child birth grant.

Conformance status

The Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) defines requirements for designers and developers to improve accessibility for people with disabilities. It defines three levels of conformance: Level A, Level AA, and Level AAA. The service is partially conformant with WCAG 2.1 level AA. Partially conformant means that some parts of the content do not fully conform to the accessibility standard.

Compatibility with browsers and assistive technology

The service is not compatible with:

  • Internet Explorer 9 and older
  • Safari browser on Windows computers

Limitations and alternatives

Despite our best efforts to ensure accessibility of the service, there may be some limitations. Below is a description of known limitations, and potential solutions. Please contact us if you observe an issue not listed below.

Header images are a known limitation for the service. Images do not have text alternatives because we have not set the ‘alt’ attribute. We'll be adding an empty alt attribute, as the images are used for decorative purposes.

Javascript is required for the service to function properly.

Assessment approach

The Digital Services Factory assessed the accessibility of the service using:

  • WebAIM’s WAVE Evaluation tool
  • Google Chrome’s Lighthouse tool

Feedback and complaints

We welcome your feedback on the accessibility of the service. Please let us know if you encounter accessibility barriers when using it:

  • Email: dsf@dits.dmrid.gov.cy

We try to respond to feedback within 30 working days

If we do not reply, or do not fix the issue, you can send a complaint to: Deputy Minister of Research, Innovation, and Digital Policy Vyronos 29 Avenue 1096 Nicosia Cyprus

Or you can email: info@dmrid.gov.cy

If you are not satisfied with their response, you can send a complaint to the Commissioner for Administration and the Protection of Human Rights (Ombudsman).

Date

This statement was created on 28 March 2022 using the W3C Accessibility Statement Generator Tool.

data.name: CookiePolicy_Instructions
data.value:
The service for Citizen Personal Data Change (χχχχχχχ.service.gov.cy) only uses cookies that are strictly necessary for the correct functioning of the website.

Cookies in use

DSFServiceDataCookie

This cookie contains encrypted information that’s entered into the form. It is automatically deleted after the user logs out, or after 14 days.

INGRESSCOOKIE

This cookie ensures that information sent to our server goes to the correct place. It is automatically deleted after the user closes their browser.

Using CY Login

When you sign in using CY Login (also known as ‘Ariadni’) to access the child birth grant service, it will save additional cookies on your device.

How to control cookies

Find out how to control and delete cookies on your device.

You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and you can set most browsers to prevent them from being placed. If you do this, however, you may have to manually adjust some preferences every time you visit a site and some services and functionalities may not work.

data.name: CookiePolicy_Title
data.value: Cookies on the Mock on Citizen Personal Data Change

data.name: Meta_Description
data.value: Get a one-off payment of up to €581 after having a baby: what you need to be eligible and how to claim the payment online.

data.name: PrivacyStatement_Instructions
data.value:
This privacy policy explains how Social Insurance Services (SIS) uses information about you, in order to process your application for a child birth grant.

Types of information collected and used

SIS collects the following information from you directly:

  • your preferred email address
  • your phone number
  • your international bank account number (IBAN)
  • your SWIFT code (if you have a bank account outside of Cyprus)

SIS collects the following information about you from CY Login:

  • your name
  • email address
  • your social insurance number
  • your identification (or alien registration) number

SIS collects the following information from the Civil Registry and Migration Department:

  • your date of birth, sex, nationality and community you belong to
  • the following information about your child or children:
    • name, date of birth, sex and identification (or alien registration) number
    • the nationality and community your child or children belong to
  • the following information about your husband or civil partner (where appropriate, and if your child is under 12 months old):
    • name, date of birth, identification (or alien registration) number, and sex
    • nationality and community they belong to

SIS uses the following information about you from its own records:

  • your social insurance contributions
  • your husband’s or civil partner’s social insurance contributions (where appropriate)
  • your IBAN (if it is already stored)

Why they use your information

This information will be collated for the purposes of programmatically checking your eligibility for the payment, and then used by examiners at SIS.

Without access to the information listed above, SIS is not able to process your application.

How your personal information is stored

The information contained within your application is stored securely on servers based in Cyprus.

Your rights

Contact cchristou@sid.mlsi.gov.cy if you want to:

  • get a copy of the information held about you
  • restrict the processing of your data
  • correct or update your personal information
  • object to the processing of your personal information
  • have your information transferred to another organisation or to you

Complaints

You can complain about the way your personal information has been used by contacting the Office of the Commissioner for Personal Data Protection.
